meanings.definition: The ethical theory that the best action is the one that maximizes overall happiness.
meanings.sent1: Utilitarianism suggests that the right choice is the one that brings the most joy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: Many people follow utilitarianism by trying to make decisions that will make the most people happy.
meanings.sent3: When faced with a dilemma, Bob jokingly said, 'I guess I'll have to consult utilitarianism to figure out what to do!'
meanings.sent4: In a world where utilitarianism reigns, every decision becomes a calculation of happiness points.
meanings.sent5: The concept of utilitarianism can be summarized as 'the greatest good for the greatest number.'

meanings.definition: The belief that the usefulness of an action is the basis for determining its moral worth.
meanings.sent1: Utilitarianism focuses on how practical an action is to decide if it is morally right.
meanings.sent2: Some people argue that utilitarianism can lead to sacrificing individual rights for the greater good.
meanings.sent3: Sarah chuckled, 'I guess utilitarianism would say eating ice cream for breakfast is morally right if it makes you productive!'
meanings.sent4: In a society driven by utilitarianism, every action is judged by its contribution to the common good.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of utilitarianism lies in its emphasis on the practical benefits of an action.
